intro: Sigmatostalix guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan star-leaf tree, is a species native to Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. This tree is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
